website_summaries.verdict: Ideal product for those who never know what to do with their keys during a run.
pros: Comes with a built-in fanny pack on the belt, so you can keep track of everything on a run
Designed to work for dogs of all sizes
Comes with reflective elements to stay safe at night
cons: Fanny pack isn't designed for larger cell phones

customer_reviews.title: Great leash for runners!
customer_reviews.text: The least is pretty good. It's sturdy and well made. The pouch has plenty of room for my iPhone 8, plus it has another pouch for keys or nutrition. Suggestion for the manufacturer: It could use a variety of leash lengths. Maybe offer a short length? Or make the current leash adjustable. Also, would love a hand leash option for when I need to unhook the dog from the waist pack. It might make the leash a little more versatile. I get that it's a "hands free leash," but sometimes we need to use a hands-on leash. It would be nice to have the option.
customer_reviews.author: TriTracie

customer_reviews.title: Smart Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love the freedom of being hands free and not having to hold onto so much leash when passing/meeting other dogs/humans. I am using “not as directed” because I’ve got the two dogs, so there is some pull and sliding of the belt, but that’s on me. The big pocket fits my iPhone 7+ in an otter box. The small pocket holds doggie bags and keys. I do wish the smal pocket had a headphone opening too, but not enough to take off a star.
customer_reviews.author: Mika H

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & handy way to walk your pup!
customer_reviews.text: I was really pleased when this leash arrived. We have a 15 lb mini Schnauzer who lunges at squirrels full throttle on walks but won't wear a harness. I thought the bungee might be a way to help her slow herself down when she tries to take off. This helped A TON immediately on walk one! It's also very heavy duty and feels well built. I run with our dog sometimes and used to use a very short leash for this but have found this so much more comfortable. Highly recommend for convenience and some better control especially for a dog under 40 lbs
customer_reviews.author: alo9377

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough. Leash a bit long
customer_reviews.text: Leash is a long and there needs to be a handle on the half way point. However just looping the leash so it's doubled over works perfectly to keep my dog near by and more control. The belt also spins/moves with my dog. However because the belt is a over an inch wide it's comfortable. My cellphone fits in it's Pocket and no matter how my dog might pull (rabbit) or spring up (squirrel), it's not gunna break
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this leash system. Being able to walk my dog(s) hands-free is awesome. I also love the reflective striping on the waistband and leash for night walks. I didn't realize how reflective it was until I saw it on my Ring doorbell cam as I approached the door. The belt is expandable so my 00 waisted daughter can wear it along with my XXL husband. The pouch portion is a little small for large phones, but mine still wedges in. The leash seems strong and has withstood my labs pulling and chewing on it - showing no damage after a few months of use. Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: DSpackman

customer_reviews.title: Boxer-approved!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t let her face in this photo fool you (my dog is terrified of bridges...) she loves this leash and so do I. I go on runs with my dog a lot but it gets hard to maneuver with hands full (phone, leash, bags, etc)...this allows me to run with her a lot more smoothly than with a traditional leash. My dog is 55 pounds. The handles on this allow me to control her a bit more when passing other people and dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not for every sized dog
customer_reviews.text: I have three dogs, small, medium and large. My plan was to use this with my split leash for the 2 larger dogs and a single leash for the little guy. The belt and D rings are perfect (although it's heavy). It is very sturdy and the belt pockets are waterproof which is great for a phone. The leash, however, is really heavy, even for my 2 bigger dogs (75lbs and 45lbs) and my little guy got confused by the D ring-I think he didn't know what to do without me holding the leash lol. My work-arounds are to attach the split leash to one D ring with a carabiner and walk my little dog normally. Now everyone is happy!
customer_reviews.author: R. Cesarz

customer_reviews.title: Maisie and I like it
customer_reviews.text: We really like running with this leash. It has saved my shoulder from the stiffness that comes with running while holding a leash. Maisie also doesn't try to pull as often, because it's harder pull from my center of gravity. I also use it for casual walks, too - it's great to have my hands free. One feature that would make this great leash even better - a handle in the middle of the leash. There is one at each end, but neither of these are truly useful. A handle in the middle would be easier and faster to grab if you need to rein the dog in.
customer_reviews.author: danno

customer_reviews.title: nothing else required
customer_reviews.text: this leash is the bomb! while i do have a hands free leash from a different company, it does not provide the features this one does, i.e 2 large zip (fold flat when not in use) pockets and places to hook things. i know longer need to add a treat bag to my body that hangs and hits my legs, hips, etc., and the feature of the handle close to the dog to hold them is genius. i highly recommend this fun and completely versatile, useful product. thank you for it, and i look forward to the public dance video you promise when you get reviews!!
customer_reviews.author: t2

customer_reviews.title: I have a mini-Aussie puppy...
customer_reviews.text: We've done the training -- and continue -- but I have another dog and she needs to go on real walks and my Aussie wants to come along. He's smaller than any dog I've had before, which has been a little challenge for me. And he's an AUSSIE and thinks he knows his "job". This belt/leash is turning out to be a great training aid. When he pulls to the end of the bungee leash, the little shock of surprise when it jerks him back makes him look around for me (as he should and never did with the normal leash). He's learning to walk with my by his own choice. PLUS it's a great break on my shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Ann Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to wear - just love it.  Sturdy for sure!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 dogs, but I'm using this on my big guy who is strong. He walks nicely, but if he spots a bunny....I need to be ready to hold on. The leash part has 2 areas for getting a good grip - I often use the loop closer to his collar for bunny events. It works awesome - so nice to have hands free as well. I highly recommend it. I actually got the recommendation from my sister-in-law who uses it to walk there big Goldendoodle. Thanks Paw Lifestyles!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Use with a 100lb dog!
customer_reviews.text: I run with my malamute mix and this leash is a life saver!!! It is perfect it absorbs his pull if he does pull so much better than prior leashes! I love that it holds my phone and that it is so easy to unhook from him as well! I love love love this leash and recommend it to all my friends who run with their dogs. I wouldn't go without! This makes is so much easier to be hand free but doesn't pull and put the strain on your back! THANK YOU for a GREAT product!
customer_reviews.author: Brock  Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great Jogging Leash
customer_reviews.text: I love this leash for jogging with my 95LB German Shepard. He is already trained on his no-pull harness not to pull, so I have no worries about him taking me down or dragging me anywhere (though I'm sure he could). The belt is adjustable, has a zipper compartment to holding keys, cards, ect, and the bungee is taught but prevents tugging from the dog. I like that there is a leash handle by the belt and also one by the dog's leash incase you need to gain control quickly. I'm really glad I picked this up!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Mooring

customer_reviews.title: Seems very well-made! 2 weeks in and all is well.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this hands-free leash for about 2 weeks so far, and the quality seems really good—heavy duty buckles and rings, and sturdier than the elastic versions of these belts I've had before. So far so good! My dogs are only 25 pounds, and the bungee leash is so tight that they can't stretch it out (which is fine with me), however the length is a little short for daily walks because of that. They're used to being on 6' leashes every day. The included leash will be perfect for events that allow dogs, to keep them closer to me in a crowd. Overall, very happy with the purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jen R.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: surprised again by the quality of this product. The only con is that if the leash is loose, the clasps and loops clank and makes annoying noises. otherwise, awesome leash. have just recently started using this consistently now that the weather is nice, and it's great. Beware of your dog stopping--the leash keeps you pretty close together, so you won't have much time to react and slow down. Also, the bungee isn't too forgiving. if you're dog pulls to go after a squirrel, you may throw your back out if you're not prepared. The pouches on the belt are essential. has some reflective material running down the leash, if you're a nighttime runner like me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Russell

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and strong!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because I am soon having shoulder surgery and will need a way to walk my two labradors hands-free. This hands free leash is totally awesome! I should have been using it for years! The bungee part of the leash makes all the difference as far as them yanking me all over the place (in other words, now they don’t!) I added a second leash since this comes in one and I have two dogs. I highly recommend this product. It is extremely sturdy and super helpful!
customer_reviews.author: J. Norris

customer_reviews.title: Not for cold weather
customer_reviews.text: The leash worked fine for about two months. I used it on the end of a retractable leash to cushion the jerk when my dog ran ahead. In NE Ohio we get some cold weather. The snap that attaches the leash to the dog collar broke in January. The little nub that you use to open the snap broke off clean. The leash did not part. I switched ends so a working snap was again at the dog end. It's now February and the second end snap broke the same way. The temperature is 25Deg F. Not all that cold. Looks like a material defect to me.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Better than a handheld!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. My dog gets excited when I reach for it and she definitely likes it better than a regular leash because of the spring the bungee gives her if she pulls. I love having my hands free when running with her. She was about 20lbs when I got it and the hook was a bit heavy for her collar, but now she’s over 30lbs and it’s just fine. I think it will hold up well when she’s double this size too (she’s just 5 months). The belt holds a lot and stays nice and flat if nothings in it. The plastic buckle can be difficult if not lined up exactly, but overall it’s worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Kellyn

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you are bigger. Size innacurate!
customer_reviews.text: Well I bought this product for my dad who has a 46 inch waist and this belt did not fit him even though it says it goes up to 48 inches. I tried it out on my husband who wears a size 38 pants and he only had about 2 inches of spare room while the belt was fully extended. Very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: CHICAGOSHENANIGANS

customer_reviews.title: Works as suggested
customer_reviews.text: My entire family uses the leash and we appreciate that it changes size pretty easily for our waist. I wish the leash it’s self could change length however because I am only 5ft so the long length of the leash has my dog soooo far away from me while running. To combat this I wrap the leash around my waist and connect it to its self and I don’t use the waists pack at all... my hubby connects it to the waists pack when he runs with the pup because he is taller.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution - Hands Free
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I have a six month old puppy and was going camping. You can imagine things can get crazy in that situation. This was the perfect solution - gave us both a great sense of "freedom". I had full use of my hands and the puppy could wander around but not unsupervised. It comes with a loop that you can use if you want to use it as a traditional leash and have more control. Two people of different sizes used it and it was easy to adjust and always comfortable. The zippered compartment is a great added touch - super useful.
customer_reviews.author: Juliet Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: This was a game changer for my dog and me. I have an 85# German Shepherd that loves to pull. Running w/ him was ok with a normal leash. But this thing changed everything! I run hands free now and it has storage (enough for phone, rx bar, and poop bags). Also, it changed the way we go on walks. He pulls bad on the leash, but with this he can't pull at all. It's amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Slaven

customer_reviews.title: awesome! Super bungee and the waist band is a ...
customer_reviews.text: awesome! Super bungee and the waist band is a game changer. So much easier to run with my dog and I use it now just to walk her around the neighborhood. The dual handle is a great idea. My only complaint is I wish there was a way yo remove the buckle from the top handle so that when you aren't using the waist band the metal buckle isn't attached to the handle. My dog has pulled before and the handle came flying out of my hand and the buckle hit my dog with a lot of force. The goods outweigh the bads for this one though. Best leash I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great, useful, and versatile!
customer_reviews.text: Walking my German Shepherd using this has been a whole new and wonderful experience. Having my hands free has been beneficial when other dogs who are not on lead approach us aggressively and I can use my trekking pole to ward them off without having to worry about holding a leash as well. If I leave it loose enough around my wait, Ava can go behind me and then in front of me as well and the waist band just slips around me without tangling us both us. Holds my iPhone, bags to clean up after Ava if I need to, keys, etc. as well and it stays comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Roo

customer_reviews.title: Great running leash!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! I like that the leash is retractable, kinda like a bungy cord so if my dog starts to pull away it doesn’t yank too hard and gives her the space to come back to me. The collapsible pockets are great to hold my phone, doggy bags, keys, and anything else I want while I’m out so I don’t need to carry any additional bags. The waist strap is comfortable and adjustable so my husband can wear it too. Also like that the leash itself can detach on both ends. The materials are pretty good quality, I can see this lasting for a long time. Highly recommend, and love that it comes from a small business!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn T Skelley

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this hands-free leash! The only issue is if my dog is into something that he shouldn't be, it takes a little more effort to pull him away because of the stretchy center of the leash. My dog is 87 pounds and yesterday he lunged for a squirrel and thanks to that stretchy part of the leash, it wasn't extremely terrible on my back. Without the stretchy part, he would have really hurt me. Great buy, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought this months ago, great leash!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for my 11 month puppy (55 lb standard poodle) and it works great. It has two pouches so I can keep my phone separate from dog treats/ poop bags and such. The pouches are not bulky but big enough to hold iPhone 8. I would highly recommend. This leash has made our walks and jogs much more enjoyable! I wish I had thought to buy this months ago.
customer_reviews.author: CPH

customer_reviews.title: Great leash!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome!! I have three dogs. We don’t run but this allows me to have a leash in each hand and the third is “floating.” There was a bit of a curve in managing when they all change directions but now I’m seamless. I leave the waist loose enough to easily spin from side to side with position changes. Also the zippered pockets are handy for a leatherman (for cactus) and poop bags. When I walk just the one dog, with a gentle lead attached to this, hiking is super easy. I do wish I could buy a second leash part for when I walk two dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Patriot1131

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Leash
customer_reviews.text: Love using this leash for runs or long walks with my dog! I really like having my hands/arms free while running, so they can swing in a more natural running form. The belt is decently comfortable. I love that I am able to fit my phone, keys, training treats, and dog poopy bags in the two pockets the belt has. The bungee leash is really cool. It is a little longer than I would like, but I do like that the leash does have handles if you need to have more control of your dog. The belt and leash feel very sturdy and well made. Overall my dog and I are very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: DKall

customer_reviews.title: Update: Item was replaced
customer_reviews.text: Update: the company sent a replacement belt. Very responsive company. We were pleased with the product until the buckle failed. These things can happy, and we’re pleased with the outcome. Original review: In less than 90 days the buckle on the waist belt failed. It’s probably just a bad buckle, but it’s a disappointment. The belt cannot be used without the buckle.
customer_reviews.author: Hoosier Dad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is my third running leash and by far the best. I love the substantial width of the belt for comfort. My pup likes to grab the leash in his mouth and pull (bad habit we're working on) but with this leash, it's less bothersome. The pockets are a great bonus. Overall, the product feels sturdy and durable. I find the length to be just right, but that's partly because my dog doesn't walk right by my side.
customer_reviews.author: A. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Loved it till it broke
customer_reviews.text: I loved this leash. But the rating for 150 lbs is not correct. My puppy broke the inner cord when he was around 70 lbs. the outer nylon is holding strong until I find a replacement. Seems like I can’t find a leash without the belt. I would buy a replacement leash and keep the belt since it’s convenient.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaMari

customer_reviews.title: Great, but with flaws
customer_reviews.text: So, I initially enjoyed it for how long it lasted; love the bungee concept. There are several things I'd change though; one is adjust the traffic handle to be higher up and easier to grasp. Not so easy to grasp, esp when line is fully extended, and you need quick hold of your dog. Love the free D ring on the belt, BUT the belt buckle could be some sort of metal because it is easy for a dog like my frenchie to easily chew and destroy the plastic buckle.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Tigno

customer_reviews.title: Shiba Inu Momma Endorsed
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this belt! Shiba Inu Momma of 2 crazy pups nearing a year old. I take super long walks with them and when my arms get tired, I hook them up on each side. I’ve even began jogging with them and the belt is a life saver! It has 2 storage sides which are great for my iPhone X, dog treats and poop baggies. Super happy and definitely recommend it for owners of 2 crazy pre-teen pups!
customer_reviews.author: MilMomma

customer_reviews.title: The best thing i bought in the last 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier with this purchase. It is very sturdy and very well made. Looks great and it fantastic to use on runs with your pooch. I do also just unclip the leash and use it as a little fanny pack when I go on walks. It fits my iPhone 10Max great in the big pocket, and the smaller pocket is being used for keys, baggies, headphones etc..
customer_reviews.author: Victoria S.

customer_reviews.title: Double handles allow for more control when needed
customer_reviews.text: As good as they come. I have another hands free leash from a different brand. Not that anything was wrong with that one but I realized I needed the second handle on the other end when my boy lunges at or won't leave something alone. Closer handle allows for more control. I use it when I bring my two babies to the groomers. While I carry one down from the SUV, I have the other hooked onto me. The hook is thick and strong. The bungee is also sturdy. He bright green handles makes it easy to spot when you need them in a split second. I should have bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: J.N.

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: Have a Ridgeback mix that is strong like a bull. Generally easy to walk but if her nose smells a deer track etc, she can pull hard. I lost the use of my right hand so this lead allows me to control her without using my good hand. Only complaint is that the “elastic” part of the lead isn’t very stretchy. Maybe it will break in.
customer_reviews.author: mencken

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome leash. Very well made, sturdy and very comfortable to wear. It fits my iPhone 8+ and other items I want to carry. The leash is very nice too, it stretches but also has enough shape and texture to hold it without having to bundle it in my hands if I need to shorten it quickly. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amy O

customer_reviews.title: Makes the walk so much better!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best leash I've tried with my large dog who, despite my efforts at training her, just loves to pull. It's much easier to have her anchored around my hips and then have one hand on the loop for balance. The bungee interior takes away the shock of any sudden squirrel attack attempts. This leash was very well designed and is great quality. I bought two in case there's a time when I can't find it again, but it's holding up very well so I'm not worried.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonA

customer_reviews.title: Overall it's a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: The belt itself is comfortable. I enjoy the two separate pockets for organizing purposes. The leash is like a bungee cord. The slight tension has my pup running better without the constant stops as before. My only complaint is the noise level that comes from the clip jostling against the ring. I plan to wrap the ring with some electric tape to soften the noise. I don't feel the noise issue deserves one less star, not sure how this is avoidable in design, so I still rate the product 5 starts. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jilliaen

customer_reviews.title: Great for strong chronic pullers-two suggestions
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with the quality and strengh of this leash. I walk trails with two mid size but energetic, strong dogs, one of whom pulls like crazy. I attach two leashes to the belt and it securely holds them while greatly reducing the strain on my back and arms. My suggested improvements would be making the belt adjustable to a smaller size - it falls to the ground if i am standing still and don't hold on to it. (I'm 5'6" and 135 lbs). Also, while the stretchiness is great for reducing strain, keep in mind it will lessen your communication/control a bit. A corrective tug on the leash does not convey.
customer_reviews.author: Zae

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for running with my labrador
customer_reviews.text: This belt is comfortable and easy to adjust and has enough space to carry my phone, poo bags, keys and some cash or a credit card. I've run 3 miles with my labrador using it and it is so freeing to have my hands free! The lead has a couple of hand loops so you can control your dog in traffic etc. Just as a caution, the zip on one of the pouches did break after a couple of uses but the seller sent me a new one almost immediately and I haven't had any issues with the new one yet. I would definitely recommend if you like to run with your dog.
customer_reviews.author: Miss T E Howes

customer_reviews.title: Walking the dogs is enjoyable again!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I got 2, 1 for each dog. My dogs pull a bit when walking but the bungee cord leash seems to Help with this. My elbows used to get sore from the pulling but after a couple weeks walking/running with them strapped to my waist I don't notice the pain. We have a Heeler and an Akita.
customer_reviews.author: Corker

customer_reviews.title: Looks dorky but is amazing for those with strong dogs
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this leash. I like to take my dog running, but she is insanely strong. I decided to purchase this after she ripped the leash out of my hand and took off down the road. She's not going anywhere now! The bungee cord design is great, too, as she likes to pull hard and this keeps her in check without hurting her throat too much. My fiance makes fun of the way I look now with my "power nerd" leash now, and he's right - it looks pretty dorky - but I could care less if it means my pup is safe. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Asuka

customer_reviews.title: Love this leash!
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed. I am confident this leash keeps my 55 lbs dog secured while I can use my hands for other things. The elastic on the leash is great because takes a lot of power when the dog is pulling. In addition, I am very found of the two pouches where I carry the cellphone, the car key and the poop bags. In a few words: great product and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: To be honest it wasn't what I was expecting. It was what I was hoping for. Keep on keeping on, sensational product. Features a sweat resistant phone pouch, leash is the perfect length to let the dog run with you. Features two high quality clasps, lthe leash is reversible ( has a short handhold, and a long handhold either way it's attached). I'm not trying to blow the deal or anything, but, they pretty much give you a jogging belt and a running leash at the same time. #thisbargainLITAF shipped super quick, got me running with the pup A$AP
customer_reviews.author: Super J-Nasty

customer_reviews.title: Quality, sturdy, works well
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy, comfortable and works for me. Take my dog running in the desert and this keeps her with me and not chasing rabbits ;) It would be prefect if there was a retractable option at the end. I actually attached my retract leash with a carabiner and this worked too, just to give her a little extra room to take a few sniffs along the trail. Overall good product!
customer_reviews.author: tmm

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Gadget
customer_reviews.text: This is a great investment for anyone hoping to run with their pup! The leash is the perfect length - I'm 5'4" and I'm not being tripped up in it while we run, and my dad who is 6'2" doesn't find it to be too short either. The belt adjusts easily to fit a wide range of body types. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Private Seller

customer_reviews.title: Great product for dogs who aren’t great on leash!
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure, this new leash just arrived yesterday and I’ve only used it on one walk so far. That said, so far, I’m very pleased with this product. It seems well made, and is comfortable. My dog(who pulls a lot normally) got used to the feel of being so attached to me quickly, and walking with this was so much more pleasant than holding a leash! I only wish the zipper pockets with placed a little closer to the front of the belt for easier access.
customer_reviews.author: Aura Aryeff

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I'm training my dog to run with me and I HATE holding things when I run. The hands free option makes running with her so easy. I love the zipper pouch that lets me carry my doggy bags and treats with me. My only issue is that it can be a bit difficult to put my phone in and take it out. It doesn't stretch as much as I anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small pocket
customer_reviews.text: Product is sturdy. Length is perfect. The only reason I didn’t give it five stars is because the pocket is kind of small. I got this for my bf and he has an iPhone smaller than my XS Max and he says it’s a pretty tight fit. So he still uses my arm band to carry his phone.
customer_reviews.author: e.p.

customer_reviews.title: Waist belt is not sturdy enough for a dog pull
customer_reviews.text: The product is really good but it has one significant problem with makes it unusable the leash is adjustable but as soon as the dock poles just a tiny little bit do you just at least gives in. so basically when you run with your dog the belt around your hip will loosen up and drop, which in return means you would have to hold it all the time. if they would make a sturdier latch then this would enhance the product and 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Value and So Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I use this leash daily for our morning run/walk and it's so awesome to also have the pouches to carry my cell phone, car key, extra doggie bags. I was hesitant because my very active dog (1.5 year old lab mix) likes to bite and pull on his leash but this leash is sturdy and has held up so far. It's exactly what we needed! I am able to run a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Ally in D

customer_reviews.title: Not good for 20lbs dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have a 20 pound Minature Schnauzer, and I’m giving the belt to my mother-in-law with a golden doodle. The clips are why too big and bulky and weigh down on my dog, and the recoil is so strong he’ll never be able to pull it. This belt is for large dogs. Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy walking my dog now!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome!! I hurt my right shoulder a year ago, and I have an energetic dog. Walking her was always stressful. Then I got this..and it changed everything! With the bungee in the lead, I don't get jerked when she goes one way or the other. She seems to behave better on this leash setup. Easy to se, very adjustable waist band. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn DumondTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Great belt, doesn’t look like a fanny pack.
customer_reviews.text: This is great! I love the stretch and comfort. My puppy can run next to me easily. I keep the belt a bit loose so if she slows down or speeds up it rotates on my belly. It doesn’t seem to matter where she is, I never hit the belt with my arms. I also bought a no pull harness to go with it and now our runs are a breeze. I love that it doesn’t look like a fanny pack, but has plenty of storage.
customer_reviews.author: Cari Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these products I’ve purchased. The leash attachment and belt seem very durable. The only suggestion I would make is to redesign the built in handles so that the loop sticks up a bit. It’s very hard to get fingers into the handle when the dog is pulling. Otherwise, great product!
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This works fabulous! Makes running with my dog SO much easier than trying to use a regular leash. Keeps her happy and saves my shoulders from constantly pulling her towards me. I also love that it keeps her centered and close while running. Only downside is it is a little hard to get the waist part to stay tight enough to my waist. While we are moving it is ok that it loosens up since my dog is pulling and it keeps the leash up, but if we stop I have to hold it!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not much stretch compared to how much elastic is put into it.
customer_reviews.text: This is an okay belt if you have a large dog but because my dog is a medium sized 20 lb dog, he's not strong enough to get any stretch in this at all so he just kind of jerks himself and me around. I ended up giving it to a friend who owns a Labrador.
customer_reviews.author: Karma

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: This product works very well with my 50 lb lab mix who is a puller. I can now run and walk her without getting my arm pulled out of my shoulder. There costumer service is hands down the best I have worked with my first leash broke after the first 2 times I used it and they responded to my email within the first hour on a Saturday evening and by Tuesday afternoon a replacement leash system was on my door step. I love taking my dog for a walk even more now that I can run and walk her with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Brigman

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, works amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality comes with very sturdy carabiners that attach to the leash. The actual leash can be fully detached which I like. I love the large pockets on the product as well. Although it doesn't exactly hold my iPhone 7plus it's still great for holding extra doggie bags and a mini flashlight. Works great because my dog doesn't walk super far ahead of me anymore and I absolutely love walking and not holding onto a leash. I can run and walk normally. Its definitely something I would pay around $40 at a PetSmart. Great product, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: cphu

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Great for Walking Multiple Dogs
customer_reviews.text: Got this leash as a gift for my sister who has an Alaskan Klee Kai and a Greyhound. She loves it! She can walk her little Klee Kai hands free while she holds her greyhound's leash, making it easier to prevent tangled leashes. I wouldn't recommend using this leash with a large dog that pulls because you might be pulled over. Awesome for cold-weather use as you can put your hands in your pockets. Nice and sturdy too; still working well a year later even with daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: The perfect belt leash marriage.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this leash and belt it allows me to be hands free but if I need to correct the dog or make sure he is safe I have two handles to grab. Brilliant design and most of the time my soft touch dog corrects herself with the bungee leash when it tugs her she gets right back in line so I don't have to do or say anything. I couldn't say enough good things about it. I have started wearing it in the house with my young pup for training so he gets used to heeling it really works great!
customer_reviews.author: PoolGirlie

customer_reviews.title: How did I live without this leash?!?!?!
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how I lived before this leash. My dog loves it too...the tug and pull of an excited puppy no more. That shock absorbing thing is dabomb.com. My dog turns around and looks at me like "what?"...did you tug me to stop? LOL- no sweet baby, you tugged yourself and now pay more attention to me as we walk. I was able to take pictures and video at events with both of my dogs with people and other dogs around, with no problems, no jerking, or pulling, with the satisfaction of knowing your dog is safely by your side. Thank you Paw Lifestyles and Amazon....exceeding expectations as always.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I have 2 puppies, 1 yr old and 3 months. They are wild! I like to have access of both hands, just in case. The belt is great for putting my phone and keys in. I don’t leave my house without this on our doggie outings.
customer_reviews.author: MPA

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great, heavy duty leash and belt. The reason for a 4/5 star rating was because the expandable pokets are made of super thick rubber-like material that overheats my phone. You can stick all kind of other things in the cool pokets: treats, doggie bags, car keys etc. Overall, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S.

customer_reviews.title: High quality, but the belt is giant!
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality leash, but the belt and its compartments is unwieldy. Tightening it leaves a large amount of extra strap that dangles around like a too-big belt, at least on me. And the compartments seem like they'd work well with a cell phone but not so much for immediate access to treats when other dogs are distracting. I'll try another that has a simpler strap where adjusting it doubles the strap rather than leaving an extra tongue hanging out, and where I can slide on better treat / poop bag holders.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Kime

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this product! I wanted a hands free belt to run with my dog. I got this one for the pockets. They are big enough I can carry my phone, dog treats and poop bags! It’s also secure enough that even running with all my stuff it doesn’t bounce around a lot and mess with my rhythm. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Zaney

customer_reviews.title: This leash is great! I have been training my five month Lab ...
customer_reviews.text: This leash is great! I have been training my five month Lab puppy I rescued ten days ago to heel which on a walk. Man, has it been a challenge. When I was using a regular leash the whole experience was tug of war chaos though I tried all the different techniques I could get my hands on. With this hands free leash, not only are her treats conveniently attached to my belt, the solid sturdiness of the actual leash has completely changed our ordeal into a much more pleasant time together. She is still learning but is quicker on the uptake. Thanks Paw Lifestyles!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: One of the most useful things we have bought from Amazon in years
customer_reviews.text: We have a 70-pound German Shepherd/Collie mix rescue-dog that loves to walk/run in the park, chase after squirrels, forcefully greet every dog that passes by... And she has a very strong pull. Our arms used to be sore after about an hour of walking her in the park. Now with the Paw Lifestyles Hands Free Dog Leash, an-hour-and-a-half hour walk feels like nothing. The leash is well designed and appears to feel easy on the both the dog and our body.
customer_reviews.author: Hahn T.

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect waist leash to take my dog on a hike ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect waist leash to take my dog on a hike or run. The bungee part allows her to not feel a sharp tug if she tries to get too far away. I also love that it is quickly adjustable around the waist when transferring the belt between different people. Easy storage for cell phones, trash bags and other little things you want to carry with you. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Great for Training and for Active Dog Owners
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing to train your dog to walk by your side, especially when they are puppies since they are not strong enough to stretch out the elastic when they are smaller. I have also used this to attach to my backpack when we are running, though it should be noted it does come with a waistband but the waistband was a little large around my waist even when I had adjusted it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simplified life
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter for Christmas and I is everything and more then I expected. She is an avid runner and takes her puppy with her every where. This product has simplified her outings 100%. She can now maintain control hands free and does not have to worry about be "dragged" or "pulled over" by her dog. Will actually be purchasing another for myself in the neat future.
customer_reviews.author: dkd

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS LEASH
customer_reviews.text: When this arrived in the mail I was pleased to see it was better quality than I was expecting. I have a 1 year old Australian Cattle Dog/Lab mix who is about 70 lbs and the leash is definitely long enough; almost too long when stretched. Love that the belt is adjustable (I can leave it loose enough so it moves with my dog). My favorite part has become the wrist loops at both ends of the leash. Having a young dog they are helpful in redirecting & keeping him from running towards other dogs (built in training tool YEAH!).
customer_reviews.author: Eran

customer_reviews.title: Good hiking leash for well trained dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have another of these stretchy bungy leashes of another brand that I paid a LOT for. I like them a lot for hiking, or walking when I need use of both hands. My dogs are well trained, so I don't have to worry about getting jerked around by the waist belt. This leash is very nice, and I like it better than my other one. If you have a puller, don't use a bungy leash. It will encourage the dog to pull, and you won't like your waist getting jerked around!
customer_reviews.author: Stockdog

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this! Great for hiking
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this! Great for hiking! Really, great for anyplace I want to take my dog alone. I have a 80+lb lab who is incredibly strong, she did not "pull me over" with this at all. I felt very secure. The waist band does run a bit small in my opinion, I had to wear it up much higher than as pictured. I'm plus size, around a size 20/22 and it was fully extended. I dont feel it would fit anyone much larger.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: This leash works great! I was originally looking at one very similar but it was $10 more. Then I saw that this one was cheaper and the #1 seller so I purchased it. It works great!! I love that the "belt" can move around if my dog is falling behind or decides to go on the other side of me (we're still working on good running behavior! She's young). The Anti-shock actually works really well! Having run with her and a normal leash before, the anti-shock is less painful for me and i'm sure her as well! I highly recommend this leash! I have a 60# lab.
customer_reviews.author: Soccere3

customer_reviews.title: Love this. Life changer
customer_reviews.text: Love the pockets on this leash. It’s so nice to walk the dog and be able to have my hands free. I have a 100lb Great Dane puppy and I’m 5’5 so using this leash lets me distribute the stress from my wrist to my waist so I have more control over him and I don’t feel like he’s going to rip the leash out of my hand.
customer_reviews.author: k griffin

customer_reviews.title: What a lifesaver! For me and my best buddy!
customer_reviews.text: This has made my life and my dogs so much easier! This works so well! The only improvement would be to add some padding and make the end have an actual handle easier to hold when it’s not on the waist band. I’m still struggling to get into the waistband pouches too so that design needs work. The main purpose is what counts and the waist band is very comfy.
customer_reviews.author: JeanDucksfan

customer_reviews.title: Great product except for the zippers.
customer_reviews.text: I like that's its hand free. Makes it so I can have more hands to deal with my daughter when we are put and about. The biggest dislike is the durability of the zippers. I used the pockets to hold my keys and when I zipped it up one of the zippers broke. So I am going to have to alter it so I can use that pocket.
customer_reviews.author: OraLee Romano

customer_reviews.title: So awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have two boxers that have consistently pulled me on all of our walks for seven years, I got this with two harnesses for my dogs and now our walks our way calmer and way more enjoyable. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ChristaB

customer_reviews.title: Look Ma, No Hands!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this belt and leash! Far better quality than any I’ve seen. I have an iPhone X with a leather case and it fits snug in one side. I’m also able to fit an entire roll of bags on the other side with a set of keys that are easy to access. I’ve walked small dogs, big dogs and two dogs at once with ease. Couldn’t recommend more!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Del Gallo

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING FOR MY 17lb JACK RUSSELL
customer_reviews.text: I have never ever written a review before- but this was worth it. My jack russell is small but mighty (like most jack russells) and this literally solved all of my problems. I can now go on runs and walks with him easily, and when he darts after a squirrel, the bungee cord leash sends him flying back to me. Most of the reviews I’ve read only apply to big dogs- this works great and is the right length for my sturdy and small jack russell too! Super well made and sleek. Also comfortable to run in with my dog by my side. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Petnuch

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic leashing system for small/medium size dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough good things about this hands free leash! It's made very well, with sturdy well placed D rings. It adjusts to whatever size waist you have. I'm 4'11, 97 lbs with a very tiny waist. But it is a bit tricky to figure out how to do it. My 15 lb puppy is quite the puller, but with this she walks by my side and keeps my pace. I do power walking for exercise, and now I can walk my dog at the same time I get my exercise. Being hands free is wonderful. And if/when I need more control, I can grab one of the two hand loops provided for use in necessary circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: Little1

customer_reviews.title: Makes my life a little easier.
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying this product. It's nice to be able to free up both hands when getting ready to go for a run or walk with my dog. I can set my activity tracker, close and lock the door with ease on our way out. The little pouch is also super convenient for carrying waste bags and keys. The bungee is nice but I do wish it offered more resistance. My dog is only about 55 lbs but very strong and he can max it out easily. I can only image what a 70+ dog would do to it.
customer_reviews.author: TXHoundUp

customer_reviews.title: This worked so much better than the retractable leash I had been using
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 90 pound lab that likes to pull. This worked so much better than the retractable leash I had been using. I was able to have better control of my dog and I enjoyed running with him more since my hands were free. I was impressed with the material the leash was made out of it - provided enough stretch that I didn't have to worry about stepping on his paws but not enough that he could go into the ditch and end up pulling me down with. I would definitely recommend this leash to anyone in the market for one - whether or not you will use it for running.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Its Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a week now and I really like it so far. It is well made, the pockets expand nicely so they can hold treats, phone, anything I need really, and the bungee leash is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth White

customer_reviews.title: Must have for active dog owners!
customer_reviews.text: I like to go hiking and if the trails allow it, I love to be able to bring my dog. But it's really difficult to take pictures or eat a snack while holding onto a leash. So I bought this product and will never go back! This would also come in handy for running with your dog, but my dog is past that age. A bonus feature of this hands free leash are the zippered pockets for dog treats, poop bag, keys, your phone, etc.
customer_reviews.author: arjuna christiansen

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect for daily runs.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the leash, it's well built. My only "complaint" is how heavy it is. It feels good, hold my cell phone and any other small items. I don't notice the weight once I get going, just initially. I also tend to catch my thumb or hand on it when walking fast. When running, I draw my arms up and out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Aspen

customer_reviews.title: Zipper on pouch broke and leash is uncomfortable to grab.
customer_reviews.text: The zipper on the phone compartment has broken after only a few uses. The rest of the leash is ok and is holding up. But if you have a strong puller, it is painful on your hands to grab the leash in the middle and very difficult to quickly get your hand inside one of the loops at the top or bottom of the leash. A loop in the middle and padded loops that stay somewhat open would make this leash much more useful.
customer_reviews.author: Cml575

customer_reviews.title: Effective running leash and excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: My dog and I couldn't be happier with this leash. She's a rescue dog and suffers from ongoing bouts of anxiety. This can manifest in her losing impulse control while on leash which makes running with her challenging. The Paw's leash springiness works magic though! Gives her just enough information as to how far to go ahead and how far to fall behind. Also, had a minor issue with one pocket on the belt. They sent a replacement immediately. Thanks Paw Lifestyle!
customer_reviews.author: Pete Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Changed the way I walk my dog!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know what I was missing until I received this in the mail. I didn't know how convenient walking my dog would be with a teathered leash! I love that this leash leaves both of my hands free and gives me better control of my pulling dog. The added pouches are what initially drew me to this leash and I definiely am taking advantage of them. I can fit my Iphone 11 in there, keys, waste bags, treats with ease. I like that the pouch doesn't stretch out to be too bulky. All in all, I am really enjoying this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Best Hands Free Leash
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this leash. I have had other hands free leashes that I ended up throwing away because the buckles would get warped or they would have a problem of loosening too easily. This leash stays tightened exactly how I set it, and the buckle is strong. Overall the materials seem very sturdy. I love how I can disconnect the leash portion all together. I actually ended up using this leash to tether my puppy nearby when we aren't walking and just disconnecting the leash portion for quick potty breaks. I don't need any of my traditional leashes anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this crazy rig
customer_reviews.text: Man, I can't believe I used to hold a leash the whole time. This is really cool. Doesn't stay put on my waist unless I've got a dog tied to it. I use a bungee splitter when I'm running with two dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased with this leash
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with this leash. The leash itself is a little too short in my opinion. I like to have 3-5 feet of space between my dog and I when running, and I did not get that with this leash. I do love the belt, however! I use the belt to walk my dog even when we are not running. It is very nice to have your body be pulled (if your dog pulls on the leash) instead of having your arms pulled. I just attached a longer leash that I had already to the belt and my improvisation worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! No longer does my dog pull on my arms and it is great for teaching him how to run. I like that you Have some pockets on it. I can store some waste bags and my phone. It also has a side clip that I attach a collapsable bowl to for water. Just used it on a 4 Mile Hike and can’t believe I lived without this thing for so long!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great hands-free running leash
customer_reviews.text: I bought this leash to run with my dog. It is working out great. I love that it has double pouches for my phone, key, and poop bags. My dog and I are able to run very comfortably using this product. This was definitely a very good purchase and I would recommend this product to others looking for a hands-free leash.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Good. Zipper broke though.
customer_reviews.text: Great leash. Our 40 lbs 8 mth old mix breed loves running and this is the only way to go. Draw back.... zipper broke around the 4th run. Used it to hold iPhone 10 and now cannot. But other than that, it’s good.
customer_reviews.author: HaydeHo

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful hands-free leash!
customer_reviews.text: This leash is great! It holds up well against my 55 lb lab/pit mix, even when she tries to go after a squirrel. I think what sets this one apart from others that I've tried is that it uses a metal clip to connect to a metal loop on the belt. Other hands-free products don't have this connection - instead the whole leash and belt were just one continuous piece, which put all of the strain on the cheap plastic belt buckle. When my dog pulled to go after a squirrel the buckle snapped in half and she was loose. This product has held up really well, I think it's a great deal for the money too!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa R.

customer_reviews.title: I'm really happy with this leash
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this leash. It's fantastic being able to run hands-free with our pup. It's a great tool for avid runners who enjoy taking their best friend for a jog. My only wish is that the leash length was adjustable. I'm only 5'2", and my dog runs fairly close to me. So the leash hangs down at his side. I do, however, love that the leash has some stretch for when we meet other dogs along the route. My dog is about 75 lbs, and without the stretch, he would easily yank me down the street. The handles also allow me to easily grab the leash and bring him back to the healing position when necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Lorie

product_meta.title: Paw Lifestyles Retractable Hands Free Dog Leash W/Smartphone Pouch – Dual Handle Bungee Waist Leash for Up to 150 lbs Large Dogs
product_meta.description:
Color:Black - Blue w/Smartphone Pouch

 Finally, the perfect dog leash for active dog lovers! This hands-free leash with Smartphone storage adds a new level of freedom & enjoyment to jogging, hiking or walking with your pup. 

 Do you love running the trails with your puppy but hate having to grip a leash the entire time? With the Paw Lifestyles Hands-Free Dog Leash, you can focus on your workout and not on your tired hands! This innovative leash attaches securely around your waist so you can free up another hand to hold your water bottle or talk on the phone. It's dog walking like you've never experienced before! 

 This intelligently designed leash features a durable shock-absorbing bungee that prevents hard pulling when your playful pooch spots a squirrel. Listen to your favorite music playlist while you store your phone, keys, and dog treats in the dual expandable pouches. You'll also like the 2 conveniently placed handles that give you excellent control over your dog. Includes an extra D-Ring to add a second leash or pet accessory.

 The Paw Lifestyles Waist Dog Leash is constructed of rugged nylon that stands up to sun, rain & snow like a champ. It also has 3 seams of reflective stitching to keep you visible in low-light conditions. Can also be used as a money or running belt! Order one for yourself and a couple more for your favorite dog owners today!

 48" Bungee Expands to 70”
48" Adjustable Waist Belt
Dual Handles For Control 
Dual Expandable Waist Pouches 
Reflective Stitching
Weather Resistant Nylon
For Dogs Up To 150 Lbs 
D-Ring For Clicker or Poop Bags 
Fits Any Smartphone

 100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE

 CLICK 'ADD TO CART' TO BUY NOW!
feature_bullets: STORE YOUR SMARTPHONE – Easily store and access your smartphone in the dual expandable pouches. Also holds your keys, cash or dog treats in the 48" adjustable waistband. Brilliant!

HANDS FREE FREEDOM – Enjoy talking on your phone or sipping a cup of coffee while you walk your dog through the neighborhood. You’ll absolutely love dog walking, running or hiking while being hands-free.

DUAL HANDLES FOR TOTAL CONTROL – Easily guide your pup on your runs through the park with the built in waist handle. Then switch to the amazing traffic handle when you need tighter control of your pet.

BE SAFE AND VISIBLE AT NIGHT: Luminous reflective threading keeps you both safe and visible on your late-evening runs. Enjoy a 2” heavy duty clip for added safety and handy D-ring to attach your favorite dog training clicker or dog poop bag holder. Perfect!

100% MONEY-BACK GUARANTEE – FOR ALL DOGS: Love your new running dog leash - or your money back! This hands free leash for dogs works great with small, medium and big dogs and works with your existing dog collar or harness. The 48 inch shock absorbing bungee absorbs quick movements from your pup. This dog running leash makes a great gift for new puppy owners! - CLICK ADD TO CART!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
